title: Commending Past Chief Edwin Venette upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition after 50 years of dedicated service to the Keeseville Volunteer Fire Dep
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Past  Chief  Edwin Venette upon the
occasion of his designation for special recognition after  50  years  of
dedicated service to the Keeseville Volunteer Fire Department

WHEREAS,  The firefighters of New York State are renowned throughout the
Nation; their reputation is synonymous with excellence  in  the  arduous
field of fire protection and prevention; and
  WHEREAS,  Since  the  early  days  of "teapot steamers," the volunteer
firefighter has been the cornerstone of our great  Nation's  efforts  to
spare us from the ravages of fire; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body is proud to commend Past Chief Edwin
Venette upon the occasion of his  designation  for  special  recognition
after  50  years  of  dedicated service to the Keeseville Volunteer Fire
Department to be celebrated Friday, December  10,  2010;  he  officially
retired in April of 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Edwin Venette joined the Keeseville Volunteer Fire Department
in April of 1960; since then, he held a line officer's position for many
years, including the esteemed title of Chief of the Keeseville Volunteer
Fire Department from 1974 to 1980; and
  WHEREAS,  Known for being exceptionally progressive, Edwin Venette was
skilled in seeking improvements for the  fire  department  through  very
limited financial budgets; and
  WHEREAS,  One  of  the  first Emergency Medical Technicians for Keese-
ville, Edwin Venette was instrumental in progressing the emergency  care
level  of the Keeseville Rescue Squad; remaining dedicated to the cause,
he attended numerous training activities throughout his  entire  career;
and
  WHEREAS,  Edwin  Venette  was  an excellent instructor for all the new
firefighters' teachings; he was a proud member of the Keeseville  Volun-
teer Fire Department's first Rappelling Team as well as the Water Rescue
Team; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition  to  serving  as a volunteer firefighter, Edwin
Venette played an active role within his community; he was the  Chairman
of the Clinton County Fire Advisory Board as well as Deputy Fire Coordi-
nator in the Fire Investigation Unit; and
  WHEREAS,  Volunteer firefighters and fire departments not only provide
the critical service of fire protection but also engage in other  activ-
ities of great benefit and importance to the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS, It takes a special dedication, a strong desire to help others
and  a  tireless sense of community to forsake precious time with family
and friends to respond to the signal that a neighbor is in  need;  Edwin
Venette  is  such a firefighter; throughout 50 years of devoted service,
this volunteer heroically performed, above and beyond the call of  duty,
those  responsibilities  which  define the task of fire protection; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Past  Chief  Edwin Venette upon the occasion of his designation
for special recognition after 50  years  of  dedicated  service  to  the
Keeseville Volunteer Fire Department; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Past Chief Edwin Venette.
